posts.post_content:
Hmmm... for most uses I'd imagine the singular Mind Stone would be a much better choice since this one seems to be less usable by most decks.
  
   
EDH decks are gonna love this... many run Mind Stone already... so this will be 3x as good in the EDH format (har har).

posts.post_content:
Took me a second to realize how good this card was, but it's good. You can use spawn tokens to pay for it, and then you have a perm 3 mana generator on the field. It fits great in R, B, or G with all the new spawn generators.  
  
3.5/5

posts.post_content:
I also like Wizards' idea about a triple [Mind Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mind Stone).  
This should be pretty useful mana accel, especially with those costy Eldrazi around.  
And after activating it the third time this will have granted you effectively free card advantage.  
  
In the worst case it's still a [Concentrate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Concentrate) for ![6](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=6&type=symbol) instead of ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol).

Posted By: Mode (4/18/2010 1:27:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
It's not bad, not great either. Interesting take on triple [mind stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=mind stone). While the mind stones purpose is to accelerate early on and be later sacced to draw more threats (or controllish stuff), this thing doesn't help you early on (obviously), but is better in the late game.  
  
I'd probably run it in some edh/commander decks that lack mana acceleration. It's a pity though that you have to tap it to sac it, so the chances of beeing able to sac it in response to a removal spell are slim.
posts.html:
It's not bad, not great either. Interesting take on triple mind stone. While the mind stones purpose is to accelerate early on and be later sacced to draw more threats (or controllish stuff), this thing doesn't help you early on (obviously), but is better in the late game.

I'd probably run it in some edh/commander decks that lack mana acceleration. It's a pity though that you have to tap it to sac it, so the chances of beeing able to sac it in response to a removal spell are slim.

posts.post_content:
This thing is insane.  
T6 This  
T7 [Kozilek, Butcher of Truth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kozilek, Butcher of Truth)  
T8 Sac to have 8 cards in hand and 5 mana to play them, chances are you might draw something like [Distortion Strike](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Distortion Strike)  
  
Obviously this can be done sooner with stuff like [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise), [Oracle of Mul Daya](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oracle of Mul Daya), [Joraga Treespeaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Joraga Treespeaker)...
